description: The world number 14 was replaced in the field by American Blayne Barber.
title: Danny Willett withdraws from Bay Hill event due to illness
title_page: Danny Willett withdraws from Bay Hill event due to illness | Daily Mail Online
text:
Danny Willett has withdrawn from the Arnold Palmer Invitational, just three weeks before the defence of his Masters title at Augusta National.
Willett was due to tee off at 8:11am local time at Bay Hill, but pulled out due to illness and was replaced in the field by American Blayne Barber.
The world number 14 will now have just one tournament, next week‚Äôs WGC-Dell Technologies Match Play in Texas, to find some form ahead of the year‚Äôs first major championship.
Danny Willett
Willett was fifth in the Maybank Championship in February after failing to convert a three-shot 54-hole lead, but then missed the cut in the Honda Classic and was 69th in a 77-man field in the WGC-Mexico Championship.
1/2 - Really sad to have to withdraw from the @APinv I've been up all night with terrible sickness.. Not ideal but felt it worse to take... ‚Äî Danny Willett (@Danny_Willett) March 16, 2017
2/2 a spot from the first reserve if I wasn't able to finish.. come Sunday im sure there'll be great champ once again. üëçüèª #LifeWellPlayed üëë ‚Äî Danny Willett (@Danny_Willett) March 16, 2017
This week‚Äôs event is the first since Palmer‚Äôs death last year. The seven-time major winner, who died at the age of 87 in September, started the event which bears his name in 1979 after buying Bay Hill Club and Lodge four years earlier.
A 14-foot bronze statue of Palmer was unveiled at the course on Saturday, while Willett was among the players who had the tournament‚Äôs ‚Äúumbrella‚Äù logo on their bags for the week.
